qas.question: Who tried to invade Cyprus in 1964?
Which US President prevented Turkey from invading Cyprus?
What policy could not be abandoned in 1964?
How many troops did Greece send to Cyprus?

context: In 1964, <a0_0>Turkey<a0_0/> tried to invade Cyprus in response to the continuing Cypriot intercommunal violence. But Turkey was stopped by a strongly worded telegram from the US President <a1_0>Lyndon B. Johnson<a1_0/> on 5 June, warning that the US would not stand beside Turkey in case of a consequential Soviet invasion of Turkish territory. Meanwhile, by 1964, <a2_0>enosis<a2_0/> was a Greek policy that could not be abandoned; Makarios and the Greek prime minister Georgios Papandreou agreed that enosis should be the ultimate aim and King Constantine wished Cyprus "a speedy union with the mother country". Greece dispatched <a3_0>10,000<a3_0/> troops to Cyprus to counter a possible Turkish invasion.
